sentence.Network_en: In his inaugural address, the President appealed for unity.
sentence.Network_cn: 总统在他的就职演说中呼吁国家统一。

sentence.Network_en: We listened to the President's inaugural speech on the radio yesterday.
sentence.Network_cn: 昨天我们通过无线电听了总统的就职演说.

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...演说，就象新英格兰清教徒在礼拜仪式上宣讲教义那样，成了群众注意力之鹄的。到了一八三二年以后，形容词“就职的”（inaugural）已经被当作名词来使用，用以表示总统的就职演说。同样的仪式也成为州长、大学校长以及其他人士就职时的例行.

2012年7月26日 - For man holds in his mortal hands the power to abolish all forms ...我有一个梦想 I Have a Dream (双语肯尼迪就职演说 Inaugural Address.
ordain v. 任命（神职）；颁发命令inaugural adj. 就职的，开幕的inaugurate v. 举行就职典礼；开创

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: from French (from inaugurer 'inaugurate', from Latin inaugurare) + -al

entry.def: An inaugural meeting or speech is the first meeting of a new organization or the first speech by the new leader of an organization or a country.

example.ex: In his inaugural address, the President appealed for unity.
example.tran: 总统在他的就职演说中呼吁国家统一。

means.word_mean: 1. an address delivered at an inaugural ceremony (especially by a United States president)
2. the ceremonial induction into a position;

sentences.sentence: "the new president obviously enjoyed his inauguration"

means.word_mean: 1. occurring at or characteristic of a formal investiture or induction;
